review_title: Poor Leadership leads to poor results
job_title: Director of Customer Support in Roy, UT
pros: ClearView is a start up through and through, you will gain lots of insight into the struggles and challenges that a startup faces. Also, due to it's small size, you will be frequently able to join leadership meetings and help discuss policy changes.
cons: Leadership is determined to take no outside funding and has taken on costly partnerships, this leads to very low pay for a tech company and a very small workforce taking on the jobs of many. The only real currency that is traded in is vision.

pros: I love the culture, love the employees, the flexibility and the location.  I learn new things all the time from the technical, sales and operations department. We have a group of smart, loyal and dedicated employees.
cons: The company is growing at a rapid rate, so sometimes things change quickly. But, if you're flexible that won't be an issue.

review_title: A good company to work for.
pros: Great work atmosphere.  Pretty flexible schedule.  Laid back environment, but still paced well.  Management is good to work with.  HR does a good job of doing monthly/seasonal work-place activities.
cons: There is a lot of growth recently, and with that is the typical growing pains.

pros: There is a good work life balance. Only because the employees are so undercompensated that they have to provide alot of job freedom in order to prevent employees from being to vocal about the cons.
cons: Undervalued, undercompensated, lack of accountability, and no direction from management is Clearview in a nutshell.

pros: We got to watch movies for free and nobody ever really attended the theater. I guess that's why it went out of business.
cons: Hours weren't consistent and there was a ton of favoritism towards the managers friends.
I need benefits but doesn't provide any
